\mes depending on head size note even though you ended with 2 row of 44 s	ches your repeat always begins with another 2 row of 44 s	ches as you make your repeats you will begin to see the top taper seam sides together to make a tube slip s	ching the back loops of each side together close top using drawstring method - weaving yarn in and out of topmost s	ches and pull \ght fold up brim to desired height ears 2 using 6mm hook and fur yarn leaving 6-inch star
g tail chain 16 tc in 3rd chain from hook and the next 8 chains for a total of 9 tc 2 double_crochet 2hdc turn chain 1 4 single_crochet and 9 double_crochet turn chain 1 slip s	ch in each s	ch to end fasten_off leaving 6-inch ending tail repeat making second ear a0ach ears to crown of hat about midway on each side thread the star
g tail and ending tail i to the hat one s	ch away from each other then \e together on the inside of the hat anchor with some addi\onal inside s	ches if needed nose 1 using 3 5 mm hook & cream yarn make a magic_ring chain 3 counts as treble_crochet and work into the ring 2 tc 2 double_crochet 2hdc 4 single_crochet 2hdc 2dc pull circle \ght you should have a semi-heart shape band fasten_off center the nose on the brim and using a tapestry needle and a length of your yarn sew around the edges going through both the brim and the main body of the hat eyes 2 using 3 5 mm hook & black yarn make a magic_ring row 1 chain 2 counts as double_crochet then 7 double_crochet into circle join to top of chain 2 pull circle \ght do not turn over row 2 chain 2 counts as double_crochet and 1 double_crochet into same s	ch 1 double_crochet in next s	ch 2 double_crochet in next s	ch all the way around fasten_off repeat making 2nd eye using cream yarn and a tapestry needle add eye accents using black yarn and a tapestry needle a0ach eyes sewing all the way around each one cords 2 using 4mm hook & blue yarn make i-cord of desired length leaving a 6-inch star
g tail chain 3 insert hook into 2nd chain and pull a loop through then insert hook into 3rd chain and pull a loop through so you have three loops on your hook carefully take the two lee-hand chains off of your hook holding them so they don t come undone you will have one loop on your hook yarn over and pull through just that loop now insert your hook into the second loop you are holding onto yarn over and pull through just that loop now insert your hook into the third loop you are holding onto yarn over and pull through just that loop you will again have three loops on your hook repeat to desired length and fasten_off leaving a very long end
